questions.question_text:
A solution is 0.1 M in Cl$$-$$ and 0.001 M in CrO$$_4^{2 - }$$. Solid AgNO3 is gradually added to it. Assuming that the addition does not change in volume and Ksp(AgCl) = 1.7 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$10 M2 and Ksp(Ag2CrO4) = 1.9 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$12 M3.

Select correct statement from the following :
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: AgCl precipitates first because its K_{sp} is high.
options.B: Ag_{2}CrO_{4} precipitates first as its K_{sp} is low.
options.C: Ag_{2}CrO_{4} precipitates first because the amount of Ag^{+} needed is low.
options.D: AgCl will precipitate first as the amount of Ag^{+} needed to precipitate is low.

questions.question: A zener diode having zener voltage 8 V and power dissipation rating of 0.5 W is connected across a potential divider arranged with maximum potential drop across zener diode is as shown in the diagram. The value of protective resistance R_{p} is .................... $$\Omega$$.

questions.question_text: A body of mass 'm' is launched up on a rough inclined plane making an angle of 30$$^\circ$$ with the horizontal. The coefficient of friction between the body and plane is $${{\sqrt x } \over 5}$$ if the time of ascent is half of the time of descent. The value of x is __________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A body of mass 'm' is launched up on a rough inclined plane making an angle of 30$$^\circ$$ with the horizontal. The coefficient of friction between the body and plane is $${{\sqrt x } \over 5}$$ if the time of ascent is half of the time of descent. The value of x is __________.

questions.question_text: In the given figure switches S1 and S2 are in open condition. The resistance across ab when the switches S1 and S2 are closed is _____________ $$\Omega$$.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In the given figure switches S_{1} and S_{2} are in open condition. The resistance across ab when the switches S_{1} and S_{2} are closed is _____________ $$\Omega$$.

questions.question_text: Two bodies, a ring and a solid cylinder of same material are rolling down without slipping an inclined plane. The radii of the bodies are same. The ratio of velocity of the centre of mass at the bottom of the inclined plane of the ring to that of the cylinder is $${{\sqrt x } \over 2}$$. Then, the value of x is _____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Two bodies, a ring and a solid cylinder of same material are rolling down without slipping an inclined plane. The radii of the bodies are same. The ratio of velocity of the centre of mass at the bottom of the inclined plane of the ring to that of the cylinder is $${{\sqrt x } \over 2}$$. Then, the value of x is _____________.

questions.question_text: For the forward biased diode characteristics shown in the figure, the dynamic resistance at ID = 3 mA will be __________ $$\Omega$$.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: For the forward biased diode characteristics shown in the figure, the dynamic resistance at I_{D} = 3 mA will be __________ $$\Omega$$.

questions.question_text: A series LCR circuit of R = 5$$\Omega$$, L = 20 mH and C = 0.5 $$\mu$$F is connected across an AC supply of 250 V, having variable frequency. The power dissipated at resonance condition is ______________ $$\times$$ 102 W.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A series LCR circuit of R = 5$$\Omega$$, L = 20 mH and C = 0.5 $$\mu$$F is connected across an AC supply of 250 V, having variable frequency. The power dissipated at resonance condition is ______________ $$\times$$ 10^{2} W.

questions.question_text: One mole of an ideal gas at 27$$^\circ$$ is taken from A to B as shown in the given PV indicator diagram. The work done by the system will be _________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$1 J. [Given : R = 8.3 J/mole K, ln2  = 0.6931] (Round off to the nearest integer)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: One mole of an ideal gas at 27$$^\circ$$ is taken from A to B as shown in the given PV indicator diagram. The work done by the system will be _________ $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$1} J. [Given : R = 8.3 J/mole K, ln2  = 0.6931] (Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.question_text: A certain metallic surface is illuminated by monochromatic radiation of wavelength $$\lambda$$. The stopping potential for photoelectric current for this radiation is 3V0. If the same surface is illuminated with a radiation of wavelength 2$$\lambda$$, the stopping potential is V0. The threshold wavelength of this surface for photoelectric effect is ____________ $$\lambda$$.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A certain metallic surface is illuminated by monochromatic radiation of wavelength $$\lambda$$. The stopping potential for photoelectric current for this radiation is 3V_{0}. If the same surface is illuminated with a radiation of wavelength 2$$\lambda$$, the stopping potential is V_{0}. The threshold wavelength of this surface for photoelectric effect is ____________ $$\lambda$$.

questions.question_text: A body rotating with an angular speed of 600 rpm is uniformly accelerated to 1800 rpm in 10 sec. The number of rotations made in the process is ___________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A body rotating with an angular speed of 600 rpm is uniformly accelerated to 1800 rpm in 10 sec. The number of rotations made in the process is ___________.
